oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Oral history interview with Adam G. Adams, III, 1976 October 04, excerpt 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville and Florida businessman and real estate broker Adam G. Adams, III, conducted on 4 October 1976 by Ann Wells as part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Tennessee Centennial Project. Adams discusses a family story about his grandfather's brother Dan taking the last daguerreotype made of Andrew Jackson. Adams died twenty-two days after this interview was conducted. The complete interview is available in the Special Collections Division.
